result.execSummary:
The defendant Raighee T Day was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Raighee T Day is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Raighee T Day was found guilty of Intimidate Witness/Conspiracy [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Repeater], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.43(4).
  • Raighee T Day was found guilty of Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Repeater], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 813.12(8)(a).
  • Raighee T Day was found guilty of Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Repeater], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 813.12(8)(a).
  • Raighee T Day was found guilty of Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Repeater], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 813.12(8)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Count one.
Counts three, four and five

Signed, Filed & Distributed, This Order (Order Rescinding Defendant's Telephone, Visitation, and U.S. Mail Custody Privileges 5/23/2014) is hereby revoked. Day shall have all privileges available to him. This order does not effect he authority of the Sheriff to discipline or modify.

Defendant Raighee T. Day in court with attorney Lucas James Kaster.  Defendant Raighee T. Day in custody.  Michael Davis Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviewed Pre-Sentence Investigation Reports, DOC  & Private, Reviewed letters to the court, and victim impact statements. Sworn by the court: DOC Agent Sylvia Ivory. Testimony. Additional statements by Quianna D. 
AS TO COUNT 2
The court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM term in the Wisconsin State Prison of 4 YEARS, concurrent to Counts 3, 4 & 5, but consecutive to all other sentences and including probation term on case 14CF1805, the term of INITIAL CONFINEMENT is 1 YEAR, the term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 3 YEARS. 
AS  TO COUNT 3
The court sentenced the defendant to a 4 MONTHS in the House of Correction, concurrent to Counts 2, 4 & 5, but consecutive to all other sentences and including probation term on case 14CF1805.
AS  TO COUNT 4
The court sentenced the defendant to a 4 MONTHS in the House of Correction, concurrent to Counts 2, 3 & 5, but consecutive to all other sentences and including probation term on case 14CF1805.
AS  TO COUNT 5
The court sentenced the defendant to a 4 MONTHS in the House of Correction, concurrent to Counts 2, 3 & 4, but consecutive to all other sentences and including probation term on case 14CF1805.

EXTENDED SUPERVISION
-Batterers Intervention program.
-AODA assessment, comply with recommended treatment.
-Absolute sobriety, random urine screens.
-Treatment and/or counseling as determined by agent.
-No violent contact with Quianna O. (D.) 
-No contact with Jerry B. or Angela O.
-Obtain/maintain employment.
-No contact with firearms.
-Court ordered defendant to pay all MANDATORY Court Costs, Fees, and Surcharges including DV & DNA, from 25% of prison funds, and then during Extended Supervision, DOC to collect, failure to pay results in a civil judgment. 
-Court WAIVED all NON-Mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges. 
-Provide DNA Sample.

*Court finds defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program OR the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
*Court advised defendant of right to seek post conviction relief.
*Court advised defendant of penalties for violation of NO CONTACT ORDER.
*Court advised due to DV conviction under federal law the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession.
*Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.

Received and filed with court.

Defendant Raighee T Day in court with attorney Lucas Kaster.  Defendant Raighee T Day in custody.  Michael Davis Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Jury returned at the hour of 9 a.m. to continue deliberations in the charge of Sheriff's Deputy Timothy Brown.  At the hour of 2:14 p.m. the jury returned and, by their foreperson, brought in a verdict of GUILTY AS TO COUNTS 2, 3, 4, and 5 which was then read.  Court polled and discharged the jury.  Verdict received and filed.  Court granted state's motion for judgment on the verdict and denied defense motion for judgment not withstanding the verdict.  Court ordered entry of judgment of conviction on those counts.  On state's motion, Court Orders PSI report without a recommendation.  Order for Presentence Investigation Report (PSI) signed and FILED.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 23. Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.  Court ordered defendant can have in-person visit with his mother.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for 10-31-2014 at 08:30 am.

Trial proceeded.  State rests on Case #14CM2956, Ct. 3.  Defense motion for directed verdict at close of state's case on that count, denied by the court.  Court holds colloquey with defendant regarding right to testify.  Jury in the box at 2:26 p.m.  Sworn for the state:  City of Columbia, MO Police Officer Cathy Daldd.  Exhibit #13 (Stipulation) read to the jury.  Jury out of box at 3:40 p.m.  The state provides an alternative to Exhibit #6, which is Exhibit #14 received.  On state's motion, Court ordered Count 3 dismissed.  Jury in box at 4:00 p.m.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Testimony closed.   Court instructed jury.  Closing arguments by state and defense.  Court charged the jury.  Alternate juror selected by lot and released.  Jury out of box at 4:52 p.m. Jury to return at the hour of 9 a.m. to deliberate in the charge of Sheriff's Deputy Timothy Brown  who was duly sworn for that purpose.  Court ordered case adjourned for jury trial in Branch 23.  Jury trial scheduled for 08-21-2014 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Raighee T Day in court with attorney Lucas Kaster.  Defendant Raighee T Day in custody.  Michael Davis Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Jury in box at 10:02 a.m.  Trial proceeded.  Sworn for the state:  Milwaukee County Sheriff's Detective Mark Gaudynski.  Exhibit #'s 2, 3 and 4 received and played for the jury.  Jury out of box at 11:00  Jury in box at 11:23 a.m.  Court resumes playing Exhibit #'s 2 and 4 for the jury.  Jury out of box at 11:54 a.m.  Court recessed for lunch.

Attorney Lucas Kaster in court, defendant Raighee T Day not in court, in custody.  Michael Davis Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Jury in the box at 2:10 pm. Sworn for the State: Jerry B. Jury out of the box at 2:30 pm. Court held voir dire with Jerry B. Sworn for the State: Angela O. Court held voir dire with Angela O. Jury in the box at 2:45 pm. Testimony of Jerry B. (previously sworn before Jury). Sworn for the state: West Milwaukee Police Officer Joseph Van Der Linden. Received exhibit #5. Testimony of Jerry B., recalled, but remained sworn.  Re-sworn before the Jury: Angela O. Sworn for the state: West Milwaukee Police Officer Sean Patyk. Jury out of the box at 3:56 pm. Jury in the box at 4:10 pm. Sworn for the State: Milwaukee County Sheriff Deputy Lavalle Morgan. Received exhibit #6.  Sworn for the state: Milwaukee County Deputy Dennis O'Donnell. Received exhibit #7. Jury instructed and released for the day ordered to return at 8:45 am to branch 23. Court placed side bar conversations on the record. Case adjourned to branch 23  Jury trial scheduled for August 20, 2014 at 08:45 am.

Defendant Raighee T Day in court with attorney Lucas Kaster.  Defendant Raighee T Day in custody.  Michael Davis Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Discussion regarding Strikes for cause, strikes placed on the record. Jury panel in the court at 10:00 am. Voir Dire continued. Thirteen (13) good and lawful citizens of the County of Milwaukee, WI qualified to serve as jurors in the above entitled cause were duly impanelled at 10:08 am. Jury list received and filed.  Remaining panel members released to Jury Management. Jury out of the box at 10:10 am. Jury in the box and sworn at 10:16 am. Court ordered witnesses sequestered.  Court instructed jury.  Opening statements by state and defense.  Trial proceeded.  Sworn for the state: West Milwaukee Police Officer Brian Chic. Exhibit #1 received. Jury instructed and released for lunch, ordered to return at 1:45 pm.  Jury out of the box at 11:20. Court placed side bars on the record. Case adjourned to 1:30 pm in branch 23.

Defendant Raighee T Day in court, in custody, with attorney Lucas Kaster.  Michael Davis Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case recalled. Discussion regarding Jury instructions and pretrial motions. For reasons placed on the record. The State motioned the court to Dismiss Count 1 of this case, GRANTED by the court. Case passed to allow Jury Panel to appear.   
Case recalled.
Jury panel in court.  Voir dire proceeded at the hour of  3:22 pm. Court instructed and released panel for the day, jurors to return to Jury Management at 9:00 am. Panel out of the box at 4:29 pm. Case adjourned for jury Trial to branch 23. 
  Jury trial scheduled for August 19, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Case Recalled, appearances remain the same. Court held in chambers conversation with state and defense counsel. Discussion regarding Motions before the court. Motion Hearing proceeded. Sworn for the state: West Milwaukee Police Officer Eric French. Arguments from state and defense counsel. For reasons placed on the record, the court DENIED the motion. Case passed to 1:30 to address court calendar.

Defendant Raighee T Day in court with attorney Lucas Kaster.  Defendant Raighee T Day in custody.  Michael Davis Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for Jury Trial. 1st call, parties are ready to proceed. Case passed to address court calendar.
Received & Filed, Motion In Limine.
State's Motion In Support of Joinder, filed by ADA Matt Puthukulam.

Attorney Lucas Kaster in court, defendant Raighee T Day not in court, in custody.  Matthew Puthukulam appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant NOT produced. Court granted joinder of 14CF851, 14CF1805, 14CM832, 14CM600, and new case 14CM2956 over the defense objection. Defense counsel enters a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND on new case. State's motion to adjourn 8/4/2014 Jury Trial date, GRANTED by the court. Case adjourned for Jury Trial to branch 23.  Jury trial scheduled for August 18, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Per state's request, case set for status conference prior to jury trial date. Matter set for 7/30/2014 at 8:30 am in branch 23.
Received & Filed, Motion In Limine.

Attorney Lucas Kaster in court, defendant Raighee T Day not in court, in custody.  Matthew G Puthukulam appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant NOT produced.  Defense counsel requests case be set for Jury Trial.  State's motioned for joinder of 14CF851, 14CF1805, 14CM832 & 14CM600 GRANTED, defense has 5 DAYS from today's date to file any motions challenging joinder.  Defendant enters a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND. State's offer is open until day of trial. Any motions must be filed within 20 days of trial.  Case adjourned for Jury Trial to branch 23.  Jury trial scheduled for August 4, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Signed, Filed & Distributed, Order RESCINDING Defendant's Telephone, Visitation, and U.S. Mail Custody Privileges.

Defendant Raighee T Day in court with attorney Lucas Kaster.  Defendant Raighee T Day in custody.  Matthew G Puthukulam appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state: West Milwaukee Police Officer Brain Chic. Court took judicial notice of certified documents regarding case #14CM600. State's exhibit #1 received into evidence.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  State's exhibit #1 withdrawn. Case is adjourned to Branch 23.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 27, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Court did NOT reinstate bail, bail remains forfeited. Court set Cash at the amount of $3000.00 with turnover to Justice Point all conditions remain.

Defendant Raighee T. Day in court , in custody, with attorney Joel Mogren for Lucas Kaster.  Matthew G Puthukulam appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for Return on Warrant. Attorney Lucas Kaster in court.  Matthew G. Puthukulam appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant NOT in court. Case passed to attempt to locate defendant. Case RECALLED. Defendant has not appeared in court.   Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued. COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT. Court ordered bail forfeited pending restitution and recompense.

Defendant Raighee T. Day in court with attorney Michael Jude as a friend of the court for Mark A. Dluzak.  Matthew G. Puthukulam appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for Preliminary Hearing. Defendant advised court that there has been a breakdown in communication that is irreconcilable.  Motion of the defense counsel to withdraw granted by the Court.  Attorney is to inform the Public Defender's Office that new counsel needs to be appointed. Court waived time limits as to preliminary hearing. Case is adjourned for status of counsel / Preliminary Hearing date to branch 23.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 31, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.    No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Quiana O

Defendant Raighee T Day in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  Defendant Raighee T Day in custody.  Kimberly D. Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grady, Branch 23. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  Defense entered a plea of NOT GUILTY as to Counts 3, 4 & 5.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 13, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
